moves.1. d4 d5 2. c4: used to be my favorite... i do prefer now c4 and Nf3, or even g3... all with the same side ideas.
moves.2... Nf6 3. Nc3 c6 4. Bg5: clear development with the idea that my queen-bishop is not my most important piece and can be exchanged if necessary.
moves.4... Bf5 5. Nf3: my main concern when I start to play is to develop. I never see any trap i could make, if ever they exist.
moves.5... Nbd7 6. e3: now, i finish my development and plan to hide. But, curiously, here, i will take time to castle.
moves.6... h6: as i said my bishop is not necessary to my mind... but...
moves.7. Bh4: i decided to force him to discover more. it is a blitz game, isn't it?
moves.9... O-O 10. Bd3: it was a time when I liked to play only with knights... I change every 6 months...
moves.10... Bxd3 11. Qxd3 b6 12. b4: of course not offering him the space to his rook.
moves.14... Rab8 15. Nd2: the attack is now on queen side. So, off we go
moves.18... Bf8 19. f3: considering the possibility to change my queen-bishop to go back to queen side
moves.19... Nh5 20. Nd1: now i changed my mind once again (often so in blitz) and tells his rook: go away! No other threats...
moves.20... g5: but he decides my bishop was more important than his rook...
moves.21... gxh4: Hm... i prefer my position to his, don't you? But, wait, there is still battle!!!
moves.22. Qd2: of course, I claim the exchange
moves.22... Qb5: of course, it does not interest him.
moves.23. Nc3 Qb3: the queen seems to like danger.
moves.24... Bg7: preparing the progression of the pawns...
moves.25... Qb8: finally taking conscious of her gracious person
moves.26. Nc4: so, the knight is going to d6 in a -pushing-back-the-queen- operation.
moves.28. Rb7: i prefer to continue the harassment
moves.30. Qb2: maybe a little bit too fast, considering the queen's attack that follows.
moves.30... exf3 31. gxf3 Qg5+ 32. Kf2: believe it or not i felt secure, though they are a lot of threats here. but black misses some material...
moves.32... h3: seems obvious. but what about the knight on d7? Is there a mate?
moves.33. Rxd7: i still felt secure... so i took it I like to test my opponents when they "try" things and hope me to panick
moves.34. Ke1 Qxh2: h3 is approaching the crucial point.
moves.35. Qb8+: occupying the furious diagonal. But will it be sufficient?
moves.36. Rxf7: grabbing, grabbing... but is it clever?
moves.36... Qh1+: i wonder if Qg2 was not better.
moves.37. Kd2 Ng3 38. Qc7: of course not Nxc7, Qg2. All was so fast! It is western here!
moves.39. Nf5 Qg2: So strange: black is all on defence!!! except of course h3 pawn.
moves.40... Nxg7: the queen is now the only attacker with the pawn and I still have a rook to sacrifice if necessary: In case he plays h2, I take the knight and then the pawn.
moves.41. Kd3 Qg6+ 42. Kd2 h2 43. Ng3: but now that the queen is on g6, I have better: i can put the knight to protect h1.
moves.44. Rf5: gotcha? Well actually, not so fast. I guess you imagined Qxf5 Nxf5 h1=Q? No, because Qxg7 mate!
